0 prcl_lift_indx -  The quantity of the degree of stability in a layer of atmosphere extending from the lifted condensation level to the 500 millibar level. K  K 
listedoperationalparcel lifted index (to 500mb) liftedIndexParcel    
1 bst_lift_indx -  A stability index that attempts to evaluate the potential for convective storm activity and that may be readily evaluated from operational sounding data. The best lifted index is the most unstable (best) lifted index determined from amoung a number of layers, between the surface and 500 mb, of the same sounding. K  K 
listedoperationalbest lifted index (to 500mb) none    
2 k_indx -  The quantity of stability used to determine thunderstorm potential based on temperature lapse rate, moisture content, and the vertical extent of the moist layer in the lower troposphere. K K K 
listedoperationalstability k index stabilityKIndex    
3 ko_indx -  The quantity of stability used to determine thunderstorm potential in Europe based on comparing low and mid level parameters. K K K 
listedoperationalko index stabilityKoIndex    
4 ttl_ttls_indx -  The quantity of stability used to determine thunderstorm potential based on the sum of the Vertical Totals Index and Cross Totals Index. K K K 
listedoperationaltotal totals index stabilityTotalTotalsIndex    
5 swt_indx -  The quantity of stability used to determine severe thunderstorm potential based on Totals Total Index, wind speeds at 850 hPa and 500 hPa, and the difference between the wind directions at 850 hPa and 500 hPa. numeric numeric numeric 
listedoperationalsweat index stabilitySweatIndex    
6 cape -  Maximum buoyant energy that an unstable air parcel can aquire. J/kg J/kg J/kg 
currentoperationalconvective available potential energy convectiveAvailablePotentialEnergy    
7 cin -  Energy needed to overcome atmospheric stability for continued spontaneous convection. J/kg J/kg J/kg 
currentoperationalconvection inhibition convectionInhibition    
8 stm_rel_helcty -  The amount of streamwise vorticity through a layer of the atmosphere when associated with a convective storm implies the likelihood of tornadic activity. m2/s2 j/kg m2/s2 
listedoperationalstorm relative helicity helicityStormRelative    
9 engy_helcty_indx -  The index that represents the amount of streamwise vorticity through a layer. numeric numeric numeric 
listedoperationalenergy helicity index helicityEnergyIndex    
10 sfc_lift_indx -  no definition available. K  K 
listedoperationalsurface lifted index none    
11 bst4_lift_indx -  A stability index that attempts to evaluate the potential for convective storm activity and that may be readily evaluated from operational sounding data. The best lifted index is the most unstable (best) lifted index determined from amoung four layers, between the surface and 500 mb, of the same sounding. K  K 
listedoperationalbest (4 layer) lifted index none    
12 rich_num -  no definition available. numeric  numeric 
listedoperationalRichardson number none

listedvalidationShowalter index none

listedoperationalupdraft helicity none

Footnotes:

  1. The Parameter Number comes from the GRIB 2 Table 4.2 series
  2. The FNMOC Identifier is the same as the name
  3. The Status may be one of the following:
    4. valuedefinition
    availableEntry was used in the past, is not in production now, and could be used again.
    currentEntry is currently in production and available to customers.
    deprecatedEntry is no longer to be used. May or may not be in production.
    listedEntry is listed in WMO documentation. Not in production with no plans to be produced.
    obsoleteEntry is not to be used and is not in production, if it ever was.
    pendingEntry is being prepared for production.
    plannedEntry is being looked at for possible production.
  4. The WMO Status may be one of the following:
    5. valuedefinition
    deprecatedEntry is no longer used.
    experimentalEntry is not recommended for use outside of bi-lateral previously agreed tests.
    operationalEntry is available for use.
    validationEntry is in the approval process.
  5. The Joint METOC Brokerage Language (JMBL) identifier
  6. The Statistical number comes from the GRIB 2 Table 4.10
  7. The Unit of Time Range comes from the GRIB 2 Table 4.4
  8. The Length of Time is multiplied by the Unit of Time Range
